intro: Raoulia beauverdii, commonly known as the Solomon Islands hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the South Pacific. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Raoulia beauverdii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland areas. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in tropical climates.
